Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Rev. Patricia A. Singletary, Pastor, Elmendorf Reformed Church, 171 East 121st Street, New York, NY 10035.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Mark-Viverito.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by:Rev. Patricia A. Singletary, Pastor, Elmendorf Reformed Church, 171 East 121 Street, New York, N.Y. 10035.

Council Member Mark-Viverito moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of December 21, 2009 be adopted as printed by Council Member Mendez.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Mendez moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of December 21, 2009 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor
Communication from the Mayor – Submitting Preliminary Mayor’s Management Report (PMMR) for Fiscal Year 2010.
Items.ActionName: Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.MatterName: Submitting Preliminary Mayor’s Management Report (PMMR) for FY'10.

Items.Title: Communications from City, County & Borough Offices

Communication from the Office of Management & Budget – Pursuant to Section 107(b) of the New York City Charter, transfer City funds between various agencies in fiscal year 2010 to implement changes to the City’s expense budget. (MN -2)
Items.ActionText: This Communication was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Transfer City funds between various agencies in FY'10 tto implement changes to the City’s expense budget. (MN -2  )

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By The Speaker (Council Member Quinn):
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-226(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 216 8th Avenue, Community Board 4, Application 20095377 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk café, 216 8th Ave, Manhattan (20095377TCM)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Chin:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-226(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 136 West Broadway, Community Board 1, Application 20105319 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk café,  136 West Broadway, Manhattan (20105319TCM)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Chin:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-226(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 107 Rivington Street, Community Board 3, Application 20105293TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk café, 107 Rivington Street, Manhattan (20105293TCM)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Mendez:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-226(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 33 Avenue B, Community Board 3, Application 20095496 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk café, 33 Avenue B, Manhattan (20095496TCM)

No. 28).

Items.MatterName: LU 28 - Zoning Resolution, Special Clinton District, Manhattan (N100052ZRM )

Items.Title: Resolution approving the decision of the City Planning Commission on ULURP No. C 100051 ZMM, a Zoning Map amendment (L.U. No. 29).

Items.MatterName: LU 29 - Zoning Map Amendment, Department of HPD Section No. 8c (C100051ZMM)

Items.Title: Resolution approving the decision of the City Planning Commission on ULURP No. C 100053 ZSM (L.U. No. 30), for the grant of a special permit pursuant to Section 74-681(a)(1) of the Zoning Resolution to allow that portion of the railroad or transit right-of-way which will be completely covered over by a permanent platform to be included in the lot area in connection with a proposed mixed-use development on property located at 592-608 Eleventh Avenue a.k.a. 507-533 West 44th Street a.k.a. 508-558 West 45th Street (Block 1073, Lot 1), within a General Large Scale Development, in R8/C2-5 and R10/C2-5 Districts, within the Special Clinton District (Excluded Area), Borough of Manhattan.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: LU 30 - Zoning, 592-608 Eleventh Avenue a.k.a. 507-533 West 44th Street a.k.a. 508-558 West 45th Street (Block 1073, Lot 1), within a General Large Scale Development, Manhattan (C100053ZSM)

Items.Title: Resolution approving the decision of the City Planning Commission on ULURP No. C 100054 ZSM (L.U. No. 31), for the grant of a special permit pursuant to the following Sections of the Zoning Resolution:  Section 74-743(a)(1) to allow the distribution of open space without regard for zoning district boundaries; and Section 74-743(a)(2) to modify the rear yard regulations of Sections 23-532 (Required rear yard equivalents) and 33-283 (Required rear yard equivalents), to modify the height and setback regulations of Sections 23-632 (Front setbacks in districts where front yards are not required), 33-43 (Maximum Height of Walls and Required Setbacks), 35-62 (Maximum Height of Wall in Initial Setback Distance) and 23-663 (Street wall location and height and setback regulations in certain districts), and to modify the minimum required distance between two or more buildings regulations of Section 23-711 (Standard minimum distance between buildings); to facilitate a proposed mixed-use development on property located at 592-608 Eleventh Avenue a.k.a. 507-533 West 44th Street a.k.a. 508-558 West 45th Street (Block 1073, Lot 1), within a General Large Scale Development, in R8/C2-5 and R10/C2-5 Districts, within the Special Clinton District (Excluded Area), in a general large-scale development, Borough of Manhattan.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: LU 31 - Zoning,  592-608 Eleventh Ave a.k.a. 507-533 West 44th St a.k.a. 508-558 West 45th St (Block 1073, Lot 1), within a General Large Scale Development, Manhattan.  (C100054ZSM)

Items.MatterName: LU 32 - Zoning, 592-608 Eleventh Ave, 507-553 West 44th St and 508-558 West 45th St (Block 1073, p/o Lot 1) Manhattan (C100055HAM)

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Waterfronts

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to increasing fines for violations of the law for illegal dumping along waterfront property into New York city waterways.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Increasing fines for violations of the law for illegal dumping along Waterfront property into NYC waterways.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to fully fund summer youth employment programs.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Youth Services
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) declared the Resolution to be adopted.
Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: NYS Legislature to fully fund summer youth employment programs.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to include $500 million in the 2010 jobs bill for a summer youth employment program and to pass the bill as soon as possible.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Youth Services
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) declared the Resolution to be adopted.
Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Congress to include $500 million in the 2010 jobs bill for a summer youth employment program.

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
Resolution adding a new rule to the Rules of the Council.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections
Items.MatterName: Adding a new rule to the Rules of the Council.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York City charter, in relation to requiring that all proposed rules be reviewed by the law department and the mayor’s office of operations.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Small Business
Items.MatterName: Requiring that all proposed rules be reviewed by the law department and the mayor’s office of operations.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the electrical code, the repeal of section 27-3025 of the administrative code of the city of New York and the enactment of a new section 27-3025.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: In relation to the electrical code.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to firefighter applicants who have completed high school in the city.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Firefighter applicants who have completed high school in the city.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to damages for delay clauses in public contracts.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Contracts
Items.MatterName: Public Contracts, Damages For Delay

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the repair of leaks occurring in certain portions of service pipes by the Department of Environmental Protection.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Leak Repair Service Pipes

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Public Service Commission to include language in utility tariffs to prohibit the placement of utility meters in front of residential buildings throughout New York City.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: NYS Public Service Commission to include language in utility tariffs to prohibit the placement of utility meters in front of residential buildings throughout NYC.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to notices of violation issued by the department of sanitation for illegal postings.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Notices of violation issued by the department of sanitation for illegal postings.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to training requirements for all persons engaged in any hoisting or lowering activity.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Training requirements for all persons engaged in any hoisting or lowering activity.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to benefits pursuant to section four hundred twenty-one-a of the real property tax law.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Benefits pursuant to section four hundred twenty-one-a of the real property tax law.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to civil penalties for unlicensed plumbing and fire suppression work.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Civil penalties for unlicensed plumbing and fire suppression work.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the operation of material hoists.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Operation of material hoists.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to payment of notices of violation for parking violations at check cashing businesses.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Payment of notices of violation for parking violations at check cashing businesses.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the implementation of technology to allow traffic enforcement agents to issue idling tickets through their hand-held computers.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Requiring the implementation of technology to allow traffic enforcement agents to issue idling tickets through their hand-held computers.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to carbon monoxide and smoke detecting devices.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Carbon monoxide and smoke detecting devices.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter in relation to authorizing the Civilian Complaint Review Board to prosecute cases of police misconduct the board has substantiated.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Authorizing the Civilian Complaint Review Board to prosecute cases of police misconduct the board has substantiated.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to bicycles offered for rental.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Bicycles offered for rental.

Items.Title: Resolution urging the United States Congress to approve a health care reform bill that will not restrict women's reproductive health or burden their right to choose by forcing women to seek alternative or supplemental insurance to obtain an abortion.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Congress to approve a health care reform bill that will not restrict women's reproductive health or burden their right to choose by forcing women to seek alternative or supplemental insurance to obtain an abortion.

Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

The following 2 Council Members formally voted against this item: Council Members Barron and Rose.

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
